revision.text: ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|nci|xiuhtotonacoche}} ===Etymology=== '''[[xiuhtotonacochtli|xiuhtōtōnacochtli]]''' "Lovely Continga-feather ear pendant" + '''[[-eh]]''' "possessor" ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|/xiwtoːtoːnakotʃeʔ/}} ===Noun=== {{head|nci|noun|head=xiuhtōtōnacocheh}} # One that has an ear [[pendant]] of [[Lovely Continga]] feathers. #* '''16C:''' [[w:Bernardino de Sahagún|Bernardino de Sahagún]], "[[w:Florentine Codex|Florentine Codex]]", book 1 #*: Auh ynjc muchichioaia: '''xiuhtotonacacohe''' catca #*: (And he was thus arrayed: he had an ear pendant of lovely continga feathers) ===References=== * {{cite-book|author=Sahagún, Bernardino de|year=1981|title=Florentine Codex: Book 1 - The Gods|others=ed. and trans. by Arthur J. O. Anderson and Charles E. Dibble|edition=2nd ed., rev.|location=Salt Lake City|publisher=University of Utah Press|page=2}} [[Category:nci:Jewelry]]
